key_points: Tampa Bay Buccaneers owner Joel Glazer praises Tom Brady's work ethic and leadership.
Glazer credits Brady with significantly changing the franchise's culture.
Brady's hard work and his relationship with everyone are highlighted as exceptional.
The 2020 season is described as 'magical', notably for winning the Super Bowl at the Bucs' home stadium.
Glazer reflects positively on the experience of providing joy to the community during the pandemic.
Brady's influence is seen as pivotal in changing the team's culture, even at 43 years old.
Glazer is optimistic about full stadiums and normalcy for the 2021 NFL season, following the pandemic.
Fans might be allowed to observe a portion of the training camp, with conditions dependent on COVID-19 developments.
The Bucs have managed to re-sign nearly all their prominent free agents, aiming to retain their Super Bowl-winning team.
Future financial challenges are acknowledged, but Glazer is optimistic, citing an expected increase in salary cap.
